title: 105_hr120
content:
The Act titled "Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997" includes definitions. Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to clarify various paragraphs and redesignate them in numerical sequence. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Amends Section 104 of title 11, United States Code by inserting ``522(f)(3),'' after ``522(d),'' each place it appears. 

SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF TIME. Amends Section 108(c)(2) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``922'' and all that follows through ``or'', and inserting ``922, 1201, or''. 

SEC. 5. PENALTY FOR PERSONS WHO NEGLIGENTLY OR FRAUDULENTLY PREPARE BANKRUPTCY PETITIONS. Amends Section 110(j)(3) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``attorney's'' and inserting ``attorneys' ''. 

SEC. 6. ELIGIBILITY TO SERVE AS TRUSTEE. Amends Paragraphs (1) and (2) of section 321(a) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``7, 12,'' and inserting ``12''. 

SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. In Section 327 of title 11, United States Code, amendments are made regarding the authority of the Trustee and limitations on compensation. The amendments include changes in subsections (b), (c), and (d) related to professional services. Additionally, Section 328(b) is amended to specify the type of professional services and persons eligible for compensation. Section 327 of title 11, United States Code is amended to change the language regarding professional services, replacing references to attorneys and accountants with the term "professional person" who renders such services. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amends Section 328(a) of title 11, United States Code to include compensation "on a fixed or percentage fee basis."

SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) of title 11, United States Code to adjust compensation for officers and attorneys.

SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code to remove certain tax provisions.

SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Amends Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code to clarify the effect of conversion on property of the estate.

SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. Introduces provisions related to automatic stay. SEC. 11. EXECUTORY CONTRACTS AND UNEXPIRED LEASES. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions related to the satisfaction of penalty rates and nonmonetary obligations in executory contracts and unexpired leases. Subsection (c) is also revised to remove paragraph (4). The amendments to Section 365 of title 11, United States Code include changes to subsections (c) and (f)(1), removing certain paragraphs and modifying others. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS. Amends the item relating to section 556 regarding contractual rights. SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. Amends section 503(b)(4) by inserting references before paragraph (3). SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. Amends section 507(a) by adjusting punctuation and adding "unsecured" after "allowed". SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. Amends section 507(a) by adjusting punctuation and adding "unsecured" after "allowed". SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. Amends section 522 by specifying liabilities and subsection references. SEC. 16. EXCEPTIONS TO DISCHARGE. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Additionally, subsection (a)(17) is modified to specify that certain debts can be imposed on a prisoner by a Federal court. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Subsection (a)(17) is modified to specify that certain debts can be imposed on a prisoner by a Federal court. Additionally, changes are made to subsection (e) regarding insured individuals. SEC. 17. EFFECT OF DISCHARGE. Amends Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, United States Code, regarding discharge effects.

SEC. 18. PROTECTION AGAINST DISCRIMINATORY TREATMENT. Amends Section 525(c) of title 11, United States Code, to protect against discriminatory treatment.

SEC. 19. PROPERTY OF THE ESTATE. Amends Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) of title 11, United States Code, regarding property of the estate.

SEC. 20. LIMITATIONS ON AVOIDING POWERS. Introduces limitations on avoiding powers. SEC. 21. LIABILITY OF TRANSFEREE OF AVOIDED TRANSFER. Amends liability rules for transferees of avoided transfers. SEC. 21 amends liability rules for transferees of avoided transfers under section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code. It clarifies the recovery process from transferees that were not insiders at the time of the transfer. SEC. 22 amends section 553(b)(1) of title 11, US Code by changing "362(b)(14)" to "362(b)(17)". SEC. 23 modifies section 726(b) by removing "1009,". SEC. 24 updates section 901(a) by adding "1123(d)," after "1123(b),". SEC. 25 addresses the appointment of an elected trustee. Section 901(a) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by inserting ``1123(d),'' after ``1123(b),''. Section 1104(b) is amended to address the appointment of an elected trustee, outlining the process and resolution of disputes. SEC. 26-30 amend various sections of title 11, United States Code, related to railroad line abandonment, plan contents, payments, and discharge. SEC. 29 amends section 1228 of title 11 by changing references from "1222(b)(10)" to "1222(b)(9)". SEC. 30 modifies section 1322 by adjusting subsections (b) and (e). SEC. 31 alters section 1328(a) by specifying types of debts not eligible for discharge. SEC. 32 amends Section 1334(d) of title 28 by changing references from "this subsection" to "subsection (c)". SEC. 33 revises Section 604 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 by removing subsection (g) and redesignating subsection (h) as subsection (g). SEC. 34 addresses knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 33 amends the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 by removing subsection (g) and redesignating subsection (h) as subsection (g). SEC. 34 addresses knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 35 specifies the effective date and application of amendments. SEC. 35 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act specifies that the Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date, and the amendments will apply to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
